intro: Loxocarpus sericeus, commonly known as the silky hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its soft, silvery foliage and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Loxocarpus sericeus is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
